explanation:
- mhd_tool_get_system_cpu_count: The function determines the initial value of sys_cpu_count. To decide whether the "else" branch (Detected ...) is ever reachable or the failure/fallback branch is unreachable, you must know the possible return values and conditions of this function.
- mhd_tool_get_sys_cpu_count_* (special_api_, sysctl_, sysconf_, sysctl_fallback_, sysconf_fallback_): mhd_tool_get_system_cpu_count delegates to platform-specific helpers. Their implementations determine whether system CPU detection can fail (<=0) or always succeed (>0), so they are needed to fully assess reachability of the branches in detect_cpu_core_count.
- mhd_tool_get_proc_cpu_count: Used as the first fallback; its possible return values (<=0 or >0) control whether the proc-fallback branch (and subsequent messages/assignments) is reachable.
- mhd_tool_get_proc_cpu_count_* (sched_getaffinity_, cpuset_getaffinity_, sched_getaffinity_np_, w32_): The proc-count routine may call platform-specific variants; those implementations determine whether proc fallback can ever succeed, so they must be inspected to decide reachability of the inner branches.
- MHD_REAL_CPU_COUNT: This preprocessor macro controls compilation of the configure-detected hardcoded fallback block. Whether it is defined (and its value) changes the compiled control flow and thus affects whether that code is reachable in the translation unit.

Note: standard I/O calls (printf/fprintf) and the caller get_cpu_core_count are not required to determine internal branch reachability of detect_cpu_core_count.
